Interface MancalaModel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Model

    public interface MancalaModel
    The MancalaModel Interface describes some functionality that will be required of the Model used for Mancala by the Mancala User Interface classes.
    Date Created: 11/07/2012
    Date Updated: 11/08/2012
    Version:
    1.00
    Author:
    Maxim Tiourin

    • Method Detail

      • isMancalaPit

        boolean isMancalaPit(int pit)
        Returns true if the given pit is a mancala pit, and false if it is a normal pit.
        Parameters:
        pit - the pit to check
        Returns:
        boolean true if the pit is a mancala pit

      • getOwnerOfPit

        int getOwnerOfPit(int pit)
        Returns the index of the player that owns the given pit.
        Parameters:
        pit - the pit to find the owner of
        Returns:
        int the index of the player who owns the pit.

      • undoTurn

        void undoTurn()
        Notifies the model that a request to undo the current turn has been made.

      • setInitialStoneCount

        void setInitialStoneCount(int count)
        Sets the amount of stones to be used for the game when it is first started, this will be called by the controller.
        Parameters:
        count - the amount of stones.

      • startGame

        void startGame()
        When this is ran the game is started over using the current settings in the model. This will be called by the controller.

      • hasGameEnded

        int hasGameEnded()
        If the game is over and one of the player's has won, returns the index of the winning player. Otherwise returns -1 to represent game still going on.
        Returns:
        int index of winning player

      • getPlayerTurn

        int getPlayerTurn()
        Returns the index representing the player who's turn it is.
        Returns:
        int value of the player who's turn it is to make a move.

      • selectPit

        void selectPit(int pit)
        Tells the model that the player has selected the given pit for their turn. The user interface will only allow the clicking of pits for the current player who's turn it is, so this does not need to be checked for validity, unless desired.
        Assumes that pits id's will be stored in a indexed manner that can be trivially checked, EXAMPLE: such as pits[0] = Model.PIT_LEFTMANCALA, pits[1] = MODEL.PIT_BOTTOM01, or some similar implementation such as this. Buttons for the pits will be indexed in such a way, so it will help to have similar architecture in the model. *
        Parameters:
        pit - the id of the pit that was selected.

      • getStonesInPit

        int getStonesInPit(int pit)
        Returns the amount of stones in the given pit.
        Parameters:
        pit - the pit to check.
        Returns:
        int the amount of stones in the given pit.

      • addChangeListener

        void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
        Adds a change listener to this models listeners;
        Parameters:
        l - the ChangeListner to add.

      • notifyListeners

        void notifyListeners()
        Notifies all of this model's listeners that change has occured.
